revised_title: Investigating Temporary Colour-Blindness and Colour Sensations
tldr: The author investigates temporary colour-blindness by exposing the eye to intense monochromatic light and measuring the colour sensations of 109 people. They discovered that different colours have varying effects on the eye, with red-blindness taking around ten minutes to recover, green-blindness lasting longer, and blue-blindness taking a couple of hours. The study provides insights into the complex nature of colour perception and the potential for temporary colour-blindness.
